Main Prey: Crustaceans, small fish, insects, amphibians, and reptiles.
Fun Fact: This species is named after the loud whooping sound it makes
Habitat: Marshes, wetlands, mudflats, and wet prairies of the United States and Canada.
Predators: Foxes, coyotes, eagles, wolves, wolverines, and black bears.
Name: Whooping Crane
